pages.text: Nigerpeton ricqlesi comes from the upper Permian, with fossils found in the Moradi Formation, Niger. It is a medium sized temnospondyl, growing up to 2.5 m in length. It is a unique temnospondyl, having not only the longest pre-orbital region (snout) of any of its family, but also bearing two cavities at the front that allowed its symphyseal tusks to stick through when its mouth was closed.

The Generic name derives from the country name 'Niger', and the Greek word 'herpeton', to mean 'crawler'. The specific name derives from the Latinised surname of Armand de Ricql√®s, whom discovered the fossil material back in the 1960s.
